info: [Breane](#Breane-Taborwin)'s love interest, a hard, bulky man from Caemlyn. He lived as a street thug, but was loyal to his queen. He joined [Morgase](#Queen-Morgase-Trakand) when she left the country.

name: Lanfear
info: One of the Forsaken. Unlike the rest of the Forsaken, she chose her name for herself, which means “Daughter of the Night” in the Old Tongue. She was born Mierin Eronaile, and was very strong in the One Power. She worked at the Collam Daan, the primary facility for research into the One Power. Her final discovery there was what she thought was a new source for the One Power, one that could be harnessed by men and women alike—this source turned out to be the emissions through a thin spot in the Pattern from the [Dark One](#Dark-One)'s prison. She and another Aes Sedai named Beidomon bored into the prison, creating what is now referred to as simply the Bore, allowing the Dark One to touch the world again and leading to the War of the Shadow. Around this time, Mierin formed a relationship with [Lews Therin Telamon](#Lews-Therin-Telamon), who headed the forces of the Light against the Shadow and was the most powerful man she had found. Lews Therin broke off the relationship when he found that she only wanted him for his power and authority and the possibility of power for herself through him. Mierin never let go of him, and when he later met and married [Ilyena Moerelle](#Ilyena-Therin-Moerelle), she tried to disrupt the wedding ceremony as well as split the two apart by any means. Eventually she went to Shayol Ghul to dedicate her soul to the Shadow, most likely to finally get back at Lews Therin for leaving her. She declared as her territory the World of Dreams, _Tel'aran'rhiod_, using it to ends now unknown. She transferred her obsessive love intact to Lews Therin's soul's new body, [Rand al'Thor](#Rand-al-Thor), after being freed from the Bore. She first appeared to him as a young woman named Selene, but disguised her appearance as a slightly less beautiful (but still stunning) woman. Almost a year later, Lanfear found that Rand had been “unfaithful” to her, and she tried to kill him. Before she could, she was pushed through the twisted stone doorway _ter'angreal_ leading to the lands of the Eelfinn by [Moiraine](#Moiraine-Damodred).

name: Larie
info: Name given to [Lemore](#Lemore) when she was collared. She lets her _sul'dam_ pet her.

name: Lem al'Dai
info: Horse-faced man from the Two Rivers. He has a gap in his front teeth from a fistfight with a wool merchant's guard long ago. He seems to like getting into fistfights.

name: Lemai
info: Aes Sedai of the Red Ajah. She was among those on the failed raiding party sent to capture the Asha'man, and was captured herself.

name: Lemore
info: Nineteen year-old _damane_. She had the misfortune of having the spark of _saidar_ manifest itself on the day Tanchico fell to the Seanchan. She also answers to her _damane_ name, [Larie](#Larie).

name: Lews Therin Telamon
info: The [Dragon](#The-Dragon), Breaker of the World. He was perhaps the greatest man who ever lived, and the most powerful Aes Sedai in recorded history. During the War of the Shadow, he led the forces of the Light against the Forsaken, and led the final stroke which re-sealed the [Dark One](#Dark-One) back into his prison. Unfortunately, during this stroke he was driven insane by the Dark One's touch, eventually killing his wife [Ilyena](#Ilyena-Therin-Moerelle), his children, and everyone he loved, as well as anyone who carried a drop of his blood. For this act, people remember him with a new name: Kinslayer. After he had done this, [Ishamael](#Ishamael) gave him his sanity back long enough for him to realize what he had done; Lews Therin killed himself by drawing on _saidin_ too heavily, causing a mountain to form on the spot where he stood. This mountain is called Dragonmount, and is near the present-day city of Tar Valon. It is unfortunate that the name of one of the greatest men to ever live is now synonymous with evil, for Lews Therin killed his family due to the Dark One's influence, but without Lews Therin there may not have been a world left in which to kill them. Lews Therin's voice often speaks inside [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor)'s head, offering advice or sobbing over lost women or ranting about killing men who can channel. It even tries to seize control of _saidin_ sometimes, much to Rand's fear—Rand is certain that Lews Therin cannot take control of _saidin_ away from him if he seizes it first, but he is almost as certain that if Lews Therin seizes it first, he will not be able to snatch it back.

name: Liah
info: Maiden of the Spear of the Cosaida sept of the Chareen Aiel with a scar across her face. When [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) came to Shadar Logoth to set wards on the Waygate there, Liah got separated from the group and was never found. Presuming she was dead, Rand took the group back to Caemlyn. When Rand returned to Shadar Logoth weeks later to fight Sammael, he discovered that Liah was still alive, if not completely sane anymore. He killed her with balefire when she was attacked by Mashadar.

name: Liandrin
info: Aes Sedai of the Black Ajah, formerly of the Red. She has light hair and a face like a doll. She grew up in Tarabon. She led the group of thirteen Aes Sedai who declared themselves Black Ajah and fled the White Tower, murdering guards and even sisters in the process. Liandrin was Red Ajah before turning to the Black, but her oath to the Black was sworn before even being raised to the Accepted (perhaps before she came to the Tower), so it cannot really be said that she was ever Red Ajah at all. She has since been shielded by [Moghedien](#Moghedien) for attempting to Compel her and given to a very enthusiastic [Temaile](#Temaile-Kinderode) to torture.

name: Lidya
info: _Damane_ in service of [Tuon](#Tuon-Athaem-Kore-Paendrag). She appears to have the Talent of Foretelling—she was able to read Tuon's fortune, in a way, and was caned by her because Tuon did not like what she told her. Tuon later apologized, realizing that Lidya had only told the truth.

name: Lina
info: Nickname [Therava](#Therava) uses for [Galina](#Galina-Casban).

name: Lini Eltring
info: Childhood nurse to Maighdin, [Morgase](#Queen-Morgase-Trakand), and [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand) Trakand. She has many wise sayings, which Elayne and Morgase are fond of quoting to themselves and others (probably because they have been ingrained into their minds so much). She went with Morgase when she fled Andor to Amadicia, and now serves as [Faile](#Faile-ni-Bashere-t-Aybara)'s chief maid.

name: Loial
info: Son of Arent son of Halan, an Ogier from Stedding Shangtai. He left the _stedding_ at around age 90 to see the world; by Ogier standards, he is not yet old enough to leave the _stedding_ without permission from the Council of Elders. He is fond of books and history, and is an excellent Treesinger. He is writing a book about his travels with the three _ta'veren_ he meets, [Rand al'Thor](#Rand-al-Thor), [Mat Cauthon](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon), and [Perrin Aybara](#Perrin-t-Bashere-Aybara). Loial is constantly afraid that his mother will find him and try to marry him off and settle him down; however, he does like his mother's choice of wives for him, Erith. He, like most of the Ogier, is sad that most humans do not remember the Ogier, and is horrified that some even think he is a Trolloc on first seeing him.

name: Lopin
info: One of [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon)'s Redarms. He has a round belly, and little hair.

name: Lord Abelle Pendar
info: Andoran noble, leader of a strong House that supported [Morgase](#Queen-Morgase-Trakand) during the Succession. Morgase exiled him from Caemlyn as per [Gaebril](#Lord-Gaebril)'s suggestion, but hopes he will still support her when she comes to claim the throne. [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand) hopes he will support her claim to the throne.

name: Lord Barthanes Damodred
info: Late lord of Cairhien. He was a Darkfriend, and when his palace was captured and he was killed, [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) converted it into a school of thought.

name: Lord Bertain Gallenne
info: Commander of [Berelain](#Berelain-sur-Paendrag-Paeron)'s Winged Guards, and her personal bodyguard of sorts. He is missing one eye.

name: Lord Captain Commander Pedron Niall
info: Former Lord Captain Commander of the Children of the Light, highest officer among the Children. He was one of the great military commanders of the world, in company with [Davram Bashere](#Lord-Davram-t-Ghaline-Bashere), Agelmar Jagad, Rodel Ituralde, [Gareth Bryne](#Lord-Gareth-Bryne), [Mat Cauthon](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon), and several Aiel chiefs. He was trying to get Altara and Murandy to cede land to Illian so the Council of Nine wouldn't invade both countries. He also tried to expand Amadicia's borders into parts of Ghealdan. His headquarters were in Amadicia, and he ruled there even above [King Ailron](#Ailron), although this was not spoken of openly. Niall recently offered a treaty with [Queen Morgase](#Queen-Morgase-Trakand) of Andor, offering Whitecloak assistance to retake her throne in exchange for Whitecloak presence in Caemlyn and elsewhere in Andor, a presence that Morgase had not allowed even a fraction of during her reign. Niall was killed by his alleged Spymaster, Abdel Omerna, who claimed he had gone against everything the Children stood for by allowing Morgase to avoid being put to the question. He was replaced by [Eamon Valda](#Eamon-Valda), who also killed Omerna. Rumor puts him dead in a duel or a skirmish.

name: Lord Davram t'Ghaline Bashere
chapter: Chapter 27: To Surprise Queens and Kings
info: Lord of Bashere, Tyr, and Sidonia; Guardian of the Blightborder; Defender of the Heartland; Marshal-General to [Queen Tenobia](#Queen-Tenobia-si-Bashere-Kazadi) of Saldaea. He is also her uncle, and [Faile](#Faile-ni-Bashere-t-Aybara)'s father. He has black eyes, a beak-like nose, and a mustache. He is also slender, and shorter than most men; his wife towers over him. He left Saldaea with his army on an order from Tenobia to bring her the head of [Mazrim Taim](#Mazrim-Taim) after he escaped; he ended up in Caemlyn when [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) defeated [Rahvin](#Rahvin). He now commands Rand's troops in Caemlyn (those that cannot channel and are not under the command of [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon) or one of the Aiel chiefs). He is feared by any potential opponents in battle, and with reason—he is one of the best generals alive.

name: Lord Dobraine Taborwin
info: Cairienin lord. He is the High Seat of House Taborwin, and commanded the troops [Perrin](#Perrin-t-Bashere-Aybara) led to Dumai's Wells. He is little taller than [Min](#Elmindreda-Min-Farshaw), and has dark eyes and gray hair. He keeps the front of his head shaved, and keeps the gray hair on the sides to his shoulders. He rules Cairhien in [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor)'s absence, and serves as his advisor in his presence.

name: Lord Gaebril
info: Man who came to Caemlyn just as riots sprang up throughout the city. He joined and led the faction that restored order in the city, and upon [Morgase](#Queen-Morgase-Trakand)'s return, he gave her her kingdom in one piece, as it was when she left. Allegedly, she was so happy that he had done this that she made Gaebril her new advisor. However, during [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon)'s trip through Caemlyn to deliver [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand)'s letter, Mat overheard Gaebril ordering someone to kill Elayne and anyone else with her—he tried to find a way to report this information to Morgase, but ended up telling Elayne. Gaebril was discovered to be [Rahvin](#Rahvin), one of the Forsaken, who has a preference to having pretty women around him. His “pretty woman” was Morgase, and he planned to wrest control of Andor from her. Morgase realized he was controlling her and left the country so quickly a rumor sprang up that she had been killed; when Caemlyn was taken by [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) and Rahvin killed, the rumor changed to say that Rand had killed Morgase, instead of Gaebril.

name: Lord Gareth Bryne
info: Former First Prince of the Sword and Captain of the Queen's Guards under [Queen Morgase](#Queen-Morgase-Trakand) in Andor. He was appointed to the position because Morgase had no living male relatives, but was exiled from Caemlyn on a suggestion from Morgase's new advisor, [Lord Gaebril](#Lord-Gaebril). He moved to his private estates in rural Andor, where he presided over the trial of three young women who unintentionally burned a barn: they turned out to be [Siuan Sanche](#Siuan-Sanche), the former [Amyrlin Seat](#Amyrlin-Seat); Leane Sharif, the former Keeper of the Chronicles, and [Min Farshaw](#Elmindreda-Min-Farshaw). When these three made an oath to serve him and then apparently broke it, he followed them out of sheer curiosity to Salidar. Once there, he discovered the true identity of the three, as well as that the Tower was truly broken. The Aes Sedai in Salidar persuaded him to command the army they would need to take the Amyrlin Seat from [Elaida](#Elaida-do-Avriny-a-Roihan), since he was the only commander that the Warders thought would be willing and able to help them. He is one of the six best military commanders west of the Aiel Waste, in a league with [Pedron Niall](#Lord-Captain-Commander-Pedron-Niall), Rodel Ituralde, [Davram Bashere](#Lord-Davram-t-Ghaline-Bashere), Agelmar Jagad, and [Matrim Cauthon](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon). Although neither of them would admit it, Bryne seems to be developing feelings for Siuan Sanche; he wishes to avoid another mistake like his relationship as [Morgase](#Queen-Morgase-Trakand)'s lover, and also never forgave Siuan for when she publicly shamed him years ago. She seems to be developing similar feelings for him, much to her dismay. He plans to be the first ever general to take the city of Tar Valon; the closest anyone else ever came was with [Guaire Amalasan](#Guaire-Amalasan)'s armies, who got as far as the White Tower itself, and [Artur Hawkwing](#High-King-Artur-Hawkwing), who never managed to go beyond beseiging the city. Actually, Amalasan's troops never beseiged the city, they simply managed to breech the walls; Hawkwing never managed to stop the supply ships coming up the river. Bryne believes he will be able to overcome this problem.

name: Lord Gawyn Trakand
info: Son of [Queen Morgase](#Queen-Morgase-Trakand) of Andor and brother to [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand). He will become First Prince of the Sword if Elayne becomes Queen. He and his half-brother Galad went to train with the Warders in the White Tower, as all sons of Andoran queens have for centuries, and both now possess considerable skill with the sword. During the chaos that erupted after [Siuan Sanche](#Siuan-Sanche)'s deposition, Gawyn formed a band of young men, everyone who had trained with the Warders except Galad, who are called the Younglings. The Younglings fought back against their teachers, who were trying to free Siuan and Leane from their imprisonment. Gawyn himself killed Hammar and Coulin, the men in charge of teaching the sword and for his personal training, respectively, both of which were Blademasters—few Warders are as good as they were, and Gawyn managed to kill both of them. With recent developments, Gawyn does not know which party to support—he believes that anyone who opposed Tower Law by trying to free Siuan and Leane was wrong, but at the same time he does not know all the facts surrounding the change in leadership. In fact, his sister Elayne and her friends [Nynaeve al'Meara](#el-Nynaeve-ti-al-Meara-Mandragoran) and [Egwene al'Vere](#Egwene-al-Vere) side with those who broke from the Tower, and Egwene, the woman he wants to marry, is their new leader. He believes the rumor that [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) killed his mother, and only refrains from killing him because Egwene made him promise not to. Gawyn has made many enemies inside and outside the Tower, just by leading the Younglings. He detests Rand because he thinks Rand killed his mother, and there is no telling how he will react when he finds out that Elayne loves him, as well as that Egwene heads the rebellion against the Tower. His sign is a white boar.

name: Lord Jarid Sarand
info: [Elenia](#Lady-Elenia-Sarand)'s husband, the High Seat of House Sarand. A square-faced man, he is dark for an Andorman. During the Succession, Jared's House opposed [Morgase](#Queen-Morgase-Trakand); after she became Queen, he was only allowed into the Palace on state occasions. When [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) killed [Gaebril](#Lord-Gaebril) and took control of Caemlyn until he could find [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand), Jarid tried to make himself fall into favor, thinking he could gain power with the new ruler. He and his wife have been exiled, but if Elenia attempts to claim the throne, Elayne expects him to assist her.

name: Lord Kayen Yokata
chapter: Chapter 27: To Surprise Queens and Kings
info: Lord of Fal Eisen, a city in Shienar.

name: Lord Logain Ablar
info: False [Dragon](#The-Dragon) who created war in Ghealdan and surrounding nations before being captured and gentled by the Red Ajah. He got loose during the chaos surrounding the deposing of [Siuan Sanche](#Siuan-Sanche), and eventually was escorted out of Tar Valon by Siuan and her traveling companions. Before he was gentled he was of considerable strength, and attracted quite a following of loyal soldiers. [Min](#Elmindreda-Min-Farshaw) still has viewings of him with a halo over his head, which she thinks indicates that he will become a figure of great power sometime in the future. Recently, Logain has come forward with information that indicates the Red Ajah actually put him up to declaring himself the [Dragon Reborn](#Dragon-Reborn), most likely with the pretext that bringing down a false Dragon would bring more glory than gentling a simple man who could channel. Logain was recently Healed by [Nynaeve](#el-Nynaeve-ti-al-Meara-Mandragoran), and was let free by [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere) to do as he pleased. He chose to return to the Black Tower, and now leads a part of the Asha'man that seem to be discontent with [Taim](#Mazrim-Taim)'s leadership. When Aes Sedai came to the Black Tower to attempt to capture the Asha'man (not realizing their numbers), Logain bonded two sisters to him as “wives” using the “wife bond” that the Asha'man developed, [Toveine Gazal](#Toveine-Gazal) of the Red Ajah and [Gabrelle](#Gabrelle) of the Brown Ajah.

name: Lord Luan Norwelyn
info: Andoran noble, leader of a strong House that supported [Morgase](#Queen-Morgase-Trakand) during the Succession. Morgase exiled him from Caemlyn as per [Gaebril](#Lord-Gaebril)'s suggestion, but hopes he will still support her when she comes to claim the throne. [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand) also hopes he will support _her_ claim to the throne. He leads one of the small armies that encountered [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere) and her group of Aes Sedai on their way to Tar Valon.

name: Lord Nasin Caeren
info: Andoran noble. He joined House Caeren to Arymilla.

name: Lord Pelivar Coelan
chapter: Chapter 27: To Surprise Queens and Kings
info: Andoran noble, leader of a strong House that supported [Morgase](#Queen-Morgase-Trakand) during the Succession. Morgase exiled him from Caemlyn as per [Gaebril](#Lord-Gaebril)'s suggestion, but hopes he will still support her when she comes to claim the throne. He is one of the lords in Andor who arrested [Naean](#Lady-Naean-Arawn) and [Elenia](#Lady-Elenia-Sarand) for claiming the Lion Throne; he later led the Andoran troops that confronted the Aes Sedai led by [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere).

name: Lord Rodrivar Tihera
info: Lean noble from Tear (a very minor noble). Dark even for a Tairen, he has a short beard trimmed to a point. He is the Captain of the Stone of Tear, the man who leads the Defenders.

name: Lord Toram Riatin
info: Cairhienin lord, son of King Galldrian. He is a Blademaster. He opposed [Colavaere](#Colavaere-Saighan), and is in league with [Caraline](#Lady-Caraline-Damodred) and [Darlin](#High-Lord-Darlin-Sisnera) against [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor).

name: Lord Willim Avarhin
info: Minor lord of Andor who was impoverished so that [Shiaine](#Lady-Shiaine-Avarhin) could take his estate.

name: Luc Mantear
info: Son of Queen Mordrellen of Andor and brother to Tigraine. Gitara Moroso, then advisor to the Queen, told him that his fame—or his fate—lay in the Great Blight. He disappeared from Andor into the Blight shortly before Tigraine disappeared, and was never seen again. Luc's soul in fact was merged with the soul of [Isam Mandragoran](#Isam-Mandragoran), [Lan](#al-Lan-Mandragoran)'s cousin, who disappeared into the Blight at about the same time. Luc/Isam now roams _Tel'aran'rhiod_ as a unified entity that can change back and forth between the two identities readily. The combined entity now serves as an assassin for the Shadow. It was Luc who killed the Gray Man that [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere) and [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand) stumbled upon in the Tower. Unlike pretty much everyone else, Luc is aware that [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) is his nephew.

name: Lydel Elonid
info: Man who will assume ownership of The Wandering Woman when [Setalle Anan](#Setalle-Anan) leaves Ebou Dar. She sold it to him because she did not like the Seanchan, but since he would be surprised to find [Joline](#Joline-Maza) hiding in the cellar, she is not letting him take control of it just yet.

name: M'Hael
info: Title used by [Mazrim Taim](#Mazrim-Taim) as the head of the Black Tower. It means “Leader” in the Old Tongue.

name: Maglin Madwen
info: Innkeeper of the Nine Rings, an inn in Cairhien. [Barmellin](#Barmellin) was going to sell him his brandy, until he saw the _sa'angreal_ glow from being used—after that, he resolved to drink it himself.

name: Maighdin Dorlain
info: Young woman that [Perrin](#Perrin-t-Bashere-Aybara) encountered who was fleeing Amadicia. She did not reveal her true identity, [Morgase Trakand](#Queen-Morgase-Trakand) of Andor—she uses her mother's name as a disguise. She became one of [Faile](#Faile-ni-Bashere-t-Aybara)'s servants, much to her own dismay (being used to _commanding_ the servants, not being one), and was eventually captured by the Shaido and made _gai'shain._

name: Manel Rochaid
info: One of [Taim](#Mazrim-Taim)'s close following Asha'man. He was among those who tried to kill [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor). He is about a head shorter than Rand. He is from Murandy.

name: Marah Anan
info: [Setalle](#Setalle-Anan)'s daughter. She is plump, and has big hazel eyes, the same color as her mother's.

name: Marille
info: Seanchan _damane_ captured by the Asha'man, now in Caemlyn. She, like many other _damane_, is convinced that she _needs_ to be collared, to protect others.

name: Marillin Gemalphin
info: Aes Sedai of the Black Ajah, formerly of the Brown. She is fond of cats, and is rarely seen without one. She is skinny, has a narrow face, and a wide nose.

name: Marin al'Vere
info: [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere)'s mother. She is an important figure in the Women's Circle in Emond's Field; she is used to getting her way with other people. [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon) recalls that she used to make very good pies, pies which he used to filch.

name: Marli Noichin
info: Seanchan _sul'dam_ captured by the Asha'man, now in Caemlyn.

name: Martyn Tallanvor
info: One of [Maighdin](#Maighdin-Dorlain)'s companions. He is actually a tall young man from Andor who served in the Queen's Guards until [Morgase](#Queen-Morgase-Trakand) fled Andor. When [Gaebril](#Lord-Gaebril) had the guards swear new oaths to the laws and customs of Andor (instead of to the Queen), Tallanvor swore them but immediately went back to his room and reswore the old oath in the old style (cutting his arm with his sword, indicating that his blood will be shed before the Queen's will). He loves his queen more than his life, and now serves as her personal bodyguard.

name: Maryl Harke
info: Woman who makes gliders at the Academy.

name: Masema Dagar
info: The [Prophet](#The-Prophet-of-the-Dragon). He was once one of Uno's underlings, and the one who respected [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) the least, but after he found out that Rand was the [Dragon Reborn](#Dragon-Reborn), he went his own way, preaching of Rand's glory as the “Lord Dragon Reborn.” Rand has since dispatched [Perrin](#Perrin-t-Bashere-Aybara) to bring Masema back into line.

name: Master Admira
info: Merchant who happens to be in Far Madding when [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) is there. He is worried about the troubles in Andor.

name: Master Azereos
info: Patron in [Mistress Gallger](#Mistress-Gallger)'s inn. He heard about [Kisman](#Raefar-Kisman)'s body, which city officials burned.

name: Master Hoffley
info: One of the two most prominent bankers in Caemlyn. He agreed to lend [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand) 20,000 gold crowns when he was informed that alum had been discovered on Elayne's estates.

name: Master Posavina
info: Patron in [Mistress Gallger](#Mistress-Gallger)'s inn who trades through Tear and Illian. He was thinking of going through Tear because he heard that [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) was in Illian.

name: Master of the Blades
info: The next step up from Swordmaster among the Sea Folk. It is the highest position a man can hold amoung them. He protects the [Mistress of the Ships](#Mistress-of-the-Ships).

name: Masuri Sokawa
info: Aes Sedai of the Brown Ajah. She grew up in Arafel, and was part of Salidar's embassy to [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor). She is now sworn to [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor), and travels with [Perrin](#Perrin-t-Bashere-Aybara) and company. She is taller than [Seonid](#Seonid-Traighan) by a hand.

name: Matrim (Mat) Cauthon
info: Young man from Emond's Field. He is _ta'veren_. Along with his good friends, [Rand al'Thor](#Rand-al-Thor) and [Perrin Aybara](#Perrin-t-Bashere-Aybara), he left home to escape the Trolloc attacks after Winternight. On the way to Tar Valon, he picked up a dagger from Shadar Logoth tainted with the evil that destroyed Aridhol, which he carried with him for a long time. He was separated from the dagger by Aes Sedai Healing, but doing so caused large gaps in his memory sequence. These gaps were filled and more when he passed through the twisted door to the land of the Eelfinn, where he was granted his three requests: a foxhead medallion that protects him from women's channeling, a way out of the land of the Eelfinn, and the memories of past lifetimes that were the gaps in his memory. Mat's _ta'veren_ qualities manifest themselves particularly well with random events, such as dice games—he almost never loses a toss of the dice, even if the dice are weighted. He has found that battles are the ultimate form of gambling, and along with his newfound memories he can win almost every battle he fights quite decisively. He has four sisters, including Eldrin and [Bodewhin](#Bodewhin-Bode-Cauthon), who are 16 and 17, respectively. His father Abell is one of the best archers in the Two Rivers, possibly in the World. Mat has gotten in the habit of carrying concealed knives under his clothes in case he is attacked—his collection would surprise anyone. In the Waste, he met a woman named Melindhra, a Maiden of the Spear from the Shaido Clan. However, she is not the [Daughter of the Nine Moons](#Daughter-of-the-Nine-Moons), who Mat is destined to marry according to the Aelfinn; besides, she tried to kill him on orders from her master among the Darkfriends. Mat had to kill her to save his own skin, but regrets it deeply. He also has a scar along his neck from where the Eelfinn tried to kill him—which was also in accordance with what the Aelfinn told him, that he is “to die and live again.” He currently leads an army called the Band of the Red Hand, after the army of King Aemon of old Manetheren, and serves in a way as Rand's personal general—this works well, since Mat seems to be a better general than even [Davram Bashere](#Lord-Davram-t-Ghaline-Bashere), who has earned his reputation as one of the best commanders alive. Mat does not trust any Aes Sedai, and because of this refuses to take his foxhead medallion off even to take a bath. Mat went to Ebou Dar to try to keep an eye on [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand) and [Nynaeve](#el-Nynaeve-ti-al-Meara-Mandragoran) and prevent them from getting themselves killed. While there he was cornered by [Queen Tylin](#Tylin-Quintara-Mitsobar), who gave him little choice but to become her lover.

name: Mazrim Taim
info: False Dragon who wreaked havoc in Saldaea before being captured by Aes Sedai. He later escaped his captors, possibly with Black Ajah assistance (although this is totally unconfirmed). Hearing of [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor)'s amnesty, Taim came to Caemlyn and became the head of Rand's school of male channelers. He is almost as strong in the One Power as Rand is. Taim claims to have held off the madness that normally accompanies the taint for almost 35 years—he has been using the One Power for a very long time, and knows many tricks that Rand had not thought of on his own or been taught by Asmodean, such as how to test men for the ability. He seems to resent being second to Rand, and also gave orders to kill Rand. He is almost as tall as Rand, has a hooked nose and dark eyes. He is a physically powerful and graceful man, although his skill with a sword is lacking.

name: Medore Damara
info: One of [Faile](#Faile-ni-Bashere-t-Aybara)'s new servants, a Tairen woman who tries to imitate the Aiel Maidens of the Spear, only using swords instead of spears. She is tall and has bright blue eyes. Her father is [High Lord Astoril](#High-Lord-Astoril-Damara). She is a member of the _Cha Faile_ (Falcon's Talon) sept of the Aiel imitators.

name: Melaine
info: Wise One of the of the Jhirad sept of the Goshien Aiel. She is a Dreamwalker, and was one of [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere)'s teachers. She can channel. She swore she would never love a man, but changed her mind later and married [Bael](#Bael), her clan chief, thus becoming sister-wife to Dorindha. She has sun-colored hair and green eyes. She is currently expecting twin daughters, whom she plans to name Min and Egwene.

name: Merana Ambrey
info: Aes Sedai of the Gray Ajah with hazel eyes. She is now an apprentice of the Wise Ones. The events following Dumai's Wells shook her so deeply that [Cadsuane](#Cadsuane-Melaidhrin) thinks she will never quite recover herself. [Min](#Elmindreda-Min-Farshaw) says that [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) should be able to trust her.

name: Merici
chapter: Chapter 15: In Need of a Bellfounder
info: One of several young girls that [Olver](#Olver) likes.

name: Merilille Ceandevin
info: Aes Sedai of the Gray Ajah. Slender and palely elegant, she has glossy black hair and large liquid eyes. She grew up in Cairhien. She was originally sent to Ebou Dar to convince [Queen Tylin](#Tylin-Quintara-Mitsobar) to support the Salidar Aes Sedai.

name: Merise Haindehl
info: Aes Sedai of the Green Ajah from Tarabon. She has dark hair and very blue eyes. She picked out the coat that [Jahar Narishma](#Jahar-Narishma), her new Warder, now wears.

name: Mervin Poel
info: Inventor in the Academy who has invented a steam-powered wagon. It does not work very well yet, and has caused a few explosions, but it has promise.

name: Mesaana
info: One of the Forsaken. During the Age of Legends, Mesaana was told she was unfit to do research at the Collam Daan, but was capable of teaching others. She spent her years teaching until the Bore was opened and she dedicated her life to the [Dark One](#Dark-One). During the War of Power, she created “schools” for the children, at which she taught the children to spy on their parents and other such things. After her release from the Bore, Mesaana set herself up in the White Tower, where she could control events without anyone suspecting she was behind them. She has been cooperating with [Semirhage](#Semirhage) to some extent, and has taught [Alviarin](#Alviarin-Freidhen) to Travel. She was displeased that Alviarin had ordered [Elaida](#Elaida-do-Avriny-a-Roihan) beaten.

name: Metwyn
info: One of [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon)'s Redarms. He is the best among the Redarms with a sword. He looks like a boy, despite being about ten years older than Mat. He grew up in Cairhien.

name: Mezar Kurin
info: Domani man with gray hair at his temples. He wears a red garnet in his ear. He is in training at the Black Tower.

name: Mili Skane
info: Saddler's daughter and Darkfriend now referred to as the Lady [Shiaine Avarhin](#Lady-Shiaine-Avarhin).

name: Milsa
info: [Zeram](#Zeram)'s wife. Since her last child got married, she has rented out the top floor of their home and shop.

name: Mishael
info: [Shalon](#Shalon-din-Togara-Morning-Tide)'s husband.

name: Mistress Andscale
info: One of the two most prominent bankers in Caemlyn. She agreed to lend [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand) 20,000 gold crowns when he was informed that alum had been discovered on Elayne's estates.

name: Mistress Doweel
info: Worker on the penance farm [Toveine Gazal](#Toveine-Gazal) worked on before [Elaida](#Elaida-do-Avriny-a-Roihan) cancelled her penance.

name: Mistress Gallger
info: Innkeeper at the inn [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) stays at in Far Madding to search for and kill the renegade Asha'man.

name: Mistress Keene
info: Woman [Verin](#Verin-Mathwin) knows. She may be the same person who keeps the inn [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) stays in.

name: Mistress Nalhera
info: Slim, gray-haired innkeeper of the inn in Far Madding where [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor), [Min](#Elmindreda-Min-Farshaw), [Alivia](#Alivia), [Nynaeve](#el-Nynaeve-ti-al-Meara-Mandragoran), and [Lan](#al-Lan-Mandragoran) stay.

name: Mistress Priss
info: Apparently a very prissy person. Used of people like [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand).

name: Mistress Shimel
info: Patron in [Mistress Gallger](#Mistress-Gallger)'s inn.

name: Mistress Thane
info: Wife of Jon Thane, miller of Emond's Field.

name: Mistress of Novices
info: The Aes Sedai who is in charge of training novices in the White Tower. The post was held by Sheriam Bayanar of the Blue Ajah until a coup that deposed [Siuan Sanche](#Siuan-Sanche) chased her out of the Tower. The post is now held by Silviana Brehon in Tar Valon and Tiana Noselle among the Aes Sedai who fled to Salidar.

name: Mistress of the Hounds
info: Name [Reanne Corly](#Reanne-Corly) uses to refer to the _sul'dam_; she uses it thus: “No, it will take time to convince the Mistress of the Hounds that she is really a hound herself.”

name: Mistress of the Ships
info: Commander of the entire fleet of Sea Folk vessels. The post is held be the formidable [Nesta din Reas Two Moons](#Nesta-din-Reas-Two-Moons).

name: Moad
info: Swordmaster to [Harine din Togara](#Harine-din-Togara-Two-Winds), Wavemistress of Clan Shodein of the Atha'an Miere.

name: Moghedien
info: One of the Forsaken. Her name means “Spider” in the Old Tongue. She always works from safety, attacks from safety, and will run unless she can do so. She developed a command of _Tel'aran'rhiod_ that surpassed even [Lanfear](#Lanfear)'s mastery—in the real world, Lanfear was more powerful, but even she could not top Moghedien in the World of Dreams. After being released from the Bore, Moghedien eventually found herself in Tanchico, in the Palace of the Panarch of Tarabon. While there, she chanced upon [Nynaeve al'Meara](#el-Nynaeve-ti-al-Meara-Mandragoran), who was trying to save the Panarch at the time and take the seal on the [Dark One](#Dark-One)'s prison from its hold in the Palace. She and Nynaeve fought in a duel to the last, and Nynaeve managed to better Moghedien, much to the surprise of both of them. She managed to escape Nynaeve's tied off shield, and on their next encounter, this one in _Tel'aran'rhiod_, she ripped [Birgitte](#Birgitte)'s soul out of the World of Dreams after Birgitte almost killed her. On her third encounter with Nynaeve, Nynaeve managed to trap Moghedien with an _a'dam_. Moghedien remained bound by that _a'dam_ in Salidar, disguised as Marigan, but was released by [Halima](#Halima-Saranov). Halima was actually one of the Forsaken, and she took Moghedien to Shayol Ghul to be bound by a _coursouvra_, a Mind Trap, controlled by [Moridin](#Moridin). Typical of her ways, she has been keeping a low profile.

name: Moiraine Damodred
info: Aes Sedai of the Blue Ajah. Born of a noble House in Cairhien, she is [Taringail Damodred](#Taringail-Damodred)'s youngest half-sister, and King Laman's niece. She is considered short among her people, and the Cairhienin are already a short people. When it was discovered that she had the ability to channel inborn, Moiraine went to Tar Valon to become an Aes Sedai. Just before being raised to the shawl, she and her friend [Siuan Sanche](#Siuan-Sanche) witnessed Gitara Moroso's Foretelling of the Rebirth of the [Dragon](#The-Dragon). Moiraine and Siuan walked away from each other and did not speak to each other again (at least in public), but both held secret communication with each other and dedicated their lives to finding and guiding the [Dragon Reborn](#Dragon-Reborn). Moiraine found the young man she sought on Winternight in Emond's Field, a young man named [Rand al'Thor](#Rand-al-Thor), along with two more _ta'veren_, [Mat Cauthon](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon) and [Perrin Aybara](#Perrin-t-Bashere-Aybara) and two women with the spark of the Power inborn, [Egwene al'Vere](#Egwene-al-Vere) and [Nynaeve al'Meara](#el-Nynaeve-ti-al-Meara-Mandragoran). When Moiraine was shortly raised to the shawl, she met [al'Lan Mandragoran](#al-Lan-Mandragoran), the uncrowned King of Malkier, who was fighting alone against the Shadow in the Blight; she asked Lan to become her Warder, and he accepted. She is very strong in the Power, stronger than almost all living Aes Sedai. In the Stone of Tear, Moiraine confronted and killed the Forsaken Be'lal with balefire, just before he would have killed Rand. Later, after having an inkling of the future events from the testing _ter'angreal_ for the Wise Ones, Moiraine managed to push the Forsaken [Lanfear](#Lanfear) through the twisted doorway _ter'angreal_. Other Aes Sedai consider her a legend, not only for discovering the [Dragon Reborn](#Dragon-Reborn) but for defeating two of the Forsaken as well. Despite her efforts, and for the most part, success, [Cadsuane](#Cadsuane-Melaidhrin) still thinks she “bungled” things with Rand.

name: Monaelle
info: Short (shorter than [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand)) Wise One with red-streaked yellow hair. She is weaker in the One Power than almost all Aes Sedai. She is the mother of seven.

name: Moridin
info: Moridin. His name means “Death” in the Old Tongue; no one deserves the name more. He is fond of using the True Power, the power drawn directly from the [Dark One](#Dark-One); the _saa_ have already appeared in his eyes, yet he still controls his use of the True Power (most thought it impossible to avoid drawing too much of it once the _saa_ appeared). Moridin is careful not to attempt to force the Pattern to behave how he wants it to—he knows that with someone as strongly _ta'veren_ as [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor), that is all but impossible, not to mention foolish. Instead, he attempts to keep everything in chaos (as per the [Dark One](#Dark-One)'s command, “Let the Lord of Chaos Rule”), hoping that subtle manipulations will further his goals. He has been declared [Nae'blis](#Nae-blis), the one to be second only to the Great Lord of the Dark after the Last Battle, and given control of the _cour'souvra_ controlling the minds of [Cyndane](#Cyndane) and [Moghedien](#Moghedien). He has also been granted the exclusive privilege of using the True Power—the other Forsaken are no longer able to touch it even should they want to.

name: Murellin
info: Strongarm for [Lady Shiaine](#Lady-Shiaine-Avarhin).

name: Mylen
info: One of six _damane_ in direct service to [Tuon](#Tuon-Athaem-Kore-Paendrag). She is very short, shorter than Tuon. She is a special source of pride as Tuon trained her herself. She was an Aes Sedai before being captured, but has been so changed by her captivity that she would betray a liberator.

name: Myrelle Berengari
info: Aes Sedai of the Green Ajah with an elliptical face. She is young (she has worn the shawl for about fifteen years), and has four Warders named Nuhel, Croi, Avar, and most recently [Lan](#al-Lan-Mandragoran), [Moiraine](#Moiraine-Damodred)'s old Warder who she is trying to save. She treats all of them as husbands in defiance of all law and custom, inside the Tower and out. She fled the White Tower when [Siuan](#Siuan-Sanche) was deposed, along with most of her Ajah. She was one of the six sisters who held much of the power in Salidar despite not being part of the Hall of the Tower. She received [Lan](#al-Lan-Mandragoran)'s bond after [Moiraine](#Moiraine-Damodred)'s death, bringing her Warder count to four, at least until [Nynaeve](#el-Nynaeve-ti-al-Meara-Mandragoran) is ready to have him as a Warder. She seems to be the resident expert on saving Warders; three of her four (Nuhel, Avar, and Lan) were previously bonded to other sisters.

name: Nadere
info: Wise One of the Goshien Aiel. She is almost stout, and has green eyes.

name: Nae'blis
info: The one who would stand only a step below the [Dark One](#Dark-One) on the Day of Return, commanding all Darkfriends in the Dark One's name. The position was promised to [Demandred](#Demandred) if he did well in his duties, as well as Sammael, but it is likely that _all_ the Chosen were offered the position if they did well. The Nae'blis has been chosen: [Moridin](#Moridin).

name: Nalesean Aldiaya
info: Late subcommander in the Band of the Red Hand. He was a blocky man, taller than [Talmanes](#Talmanes-Delovinde) or Daerid. He led the other half of the Band of the Red Hand's cavalry, the part Talmanes did not command. He kept a pointed black beard.

name: Nana
info: One of [Berelain](#Berelain-sur-Paendrag-Paeron)'s servants.

name: Narvais Maslin
info: Servant of the First Council of Far Madding.

name: Narvin
chapter: Chapter 28: News in a Cloth Sack
info: Stout, gray-haired, high-placed servant in [Queen Tylin](#Tylin-Quintara-Mitsobar)'s palace.

name: Ned Yarman
info: Warder bonded to [Sareitha](#Sareitha-Tomares). He is a tall, broad-shouldered young man with blond hair to his shoulders and bright blue eyes. He and Sareitha have been bonded less than one year.

name: Neferi
info: Former _Soe'feia_ to [Tuon](#Tuon-Athaem-Kore-Paendrag). She died by falling down stairs and breaking her neck (which you have to admit seems a little fishy).

name: Neilyn
chapter: Chapter 15: In Need of a Bellfounder
info: One of several young girls that [Olver](#Olver) likes.

name: Nerim
info: One of [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon)'s Redarms. He is short even for a Cairhienin, skinny, pale, and has gray in his hair.

name: Nesta din Reas Two Moons
info: [Mistress of the Ships](#Mistress-of-the-Ships) to the Atha'an Miere. She is used to getting what she wants, with good reason. She has been captured by the Seanchan.

name: Nestelle din Sakura South Star
info: Windfinder who [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon) freed before carrying out his own plan of escape.

name: Nesune Bihara
info: Aes Sedai of the Brown Ajah. She is one of the Aes Sedai now sworn [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor); she assisted in his kidnapping. She always listens to all sides before drawing any conclusions, and she remembers _everything_. She is slender, has black eyes, and grew up in Kandor. [Min](#Elmindreda-Min-Farshaw) had a viewing of her: she will found a library. She is now one of [Cadsuane](#Cadsuane-Melaidhrin)'s companions.

name: Nethan
info: Warder to [Merise](#Merise-Haindehl), one of the Aes Sedai who now stays near [Cadsuane](#Cadsuane-Melaidhrin).

name: Nevarin
info: Wise One with green eyes. She is thin, and has long, yellow hair. She went with [Perrin](#Perrin-t-Bashere-Aybara) to seek out [Masema](#Masema-Dagar).

name: Niko Tokama
info: Inventor at the Academy.

name: Nisa
info: [Barmellin](#Barmellin)'s horse.

name: Noal Charin
info: Man who inadvertantly chased away the _gholam_ that tried to kill [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon) in Ebou Dar. He was as surprised as Mat to see the creature squeeze between two bricks in the wall.

name: Nuli
info: Name [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) uses while masquerading as a bum in the Palace with [Min](#Elmindreda-Min-Farshaw).

name: Olver
chapter: Chapter 15: In Need of a Bellfounder
info: Boy of nine who sat on the wrong horse and almost had his neck broken for the trouble. He is adopted after a fashion by [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon) and his Band of the Red Hand. His parents were killed when the Shaido ravaged Cairhien. He is short, pale, and quite ugly. He likes to chase women.

name: Osan'gar
info: Name given to the reincarnation of one of the Forsaken. It was the left-hand dagger in a form of dueling popular right after the creation of the Bore. The sport fell from common practice, since almost invariably both duelists died from the slow poison on the daggers. Osan'gar states that he helped make the Trollocs.

name: Padan Fain
info: Former peddler that frequently came to Emond's Field. A Darkfriend, he was given orders to locate the [Dragon Reborn](#Dragon-Reborn) and narrowed it to three boys in Emond's Field. While persuing them, he encountered the spirit of Mordeth in Aridhol, now called Shadar Logoth. Mordeth attempted to consume Fain's soul, but instead the two souls merged, producing something more evil than either of them alone. Fain no longer takes his orders from the Shadow; he has his own evil agenda. It is said, “The look of the Eyeless is fear,” from observing that a Myrddraal's look causes fear in the hearts of men. Fain's look has that effect on Myrddraal—Fades feel the same fear of Fain as men feel from a Fade. Fain is also called Ordeith, a name he adopted to become a Whitecloak officer. He is perhaps the most evil man alive. He now served for a time as advisor to [Toram Riatin](#Lord-Toram-Riatin), one of the Cairhienin nobles in rebellion to [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor). Rand has a bounty of 100,000 gold crowns on his head—Fain killed Rand's friends because they were his friends, he pillaged his homeland because it was his homeland, and Rand intends to see him dead for it. In addition, [Moridin](#Moridin) is now hunting Fain, although indirectly—he sent [Isam](#Isam-Mandragoran) (alias Slayer) to kill him.

name: Panarch Farede
info: Panarch of Tarabon near the end of the War of the Hundred Years. She was responsible for promulgating the calendar that now bears her name, which measures years of the New Era (NE), the first of which marked the (arbitrary) end of the War.

name: Peral Torval
info: One of [Taim](#Mazrim-Taim)'s close-following Asha'man. He is close to his middle years, and has a sharp nose. He grew up in Tarabon. He was among those who tried to kill [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor).

name: Perrin t'Bashere Aybara
info: A young man from Emond's Field. He is _ta'veren_. When he and [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere) got separated from the rest of the group while fleeing the Trollocs on Winternight, Perrin met a man named [Elyas Machera](#Elyas-Machera). Elyas, a former Warder who found he could talk to wolves, helped Perrin discover the same ability in himself. Perrin's eyes are now yellow, just like the wolves' eyes, and he can enter what he calls the Wolf Dream (known to most as _Tel'aran'rhiod_, the World of Dreams) with them. Perrin is a childhood friend of fellow _ta'veren_ [Rand al'Thor](#Rand-al-Thor) and [Mat Cauthon](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon). On the way to Tear, Perrin encountered a young woman by the name of Zarine Bashere, a Hunter for the Horn who took the name of [Faile](#Faile-ni-Bashere-t-Aybara) (which means “Falcon” in the Old Tongue) as a more appropriate name for a Hunter for the Horn. The two are now married. Perrin is a very large man—he was always a big person, which caused him to be very cautious since he found as a child that he could easily hurt other children if his temper got out of hand. His size helped considerably when helping [Master Luhhan](#Haral-Luhhan) on his forge, but sometimes gives others the impression that he is slow and stupid. He returned to the Two Rivers for a time to repel the series of Trolloc attacks; he and his wife are recognized as Lord and Lady there, the first noblility of the Two Rivers since the Trolloc Wars. When he returned, he began to draw the eye of [Berelain sur Paendrag Paeron](#Berelain-sur-Paendrag-Paeron), the First of Mayene—Perrin wants nothing more than to be as far from her as possible, but Berelain will not take no for an answer, much to Faile's dismay and intense jealousy. Perrin was instrumental in freeing Rand from his entrapment at Dumai's Wells; the two had a fight afterwards (they had planned it as a way for Perrin to leave, although they most likely did not plan on it being as violent as it was), and Perrin went to Ghealdan to see if he could tame [Masema](#Masema-Dagar). On the way, his wife was captured by Shaido, and now he must track her down.

name: Pevara Tazanovni
info: Aes Sedai of the Red Ajah. She is plump but tough. She and her friend since novicehood, [Seaine](#Seaine-Herimon), are now leading a hunt for Darkfriends in the Tower. Seaine approached her not only because they were friends, but because Seaine's family was killed by Darkfriends when she was young. She joined the Red Ajah because its task was one which involved being outside the Tower often, and she considered it more likely to be able to find and bring to justice the Darkfriends that killed her family and others like them.

name: Pips
chapter: Chapter 15: In Need of a Bellfounder
info: [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon)'s brown gelding. He does not look like much, but is actually a very good, sturdy horse. He is stuck in the stable in the Tarasin Palace, and if Mat wants to leave Ebou Dar he will have to get him out.

name: Powl
info: One of [Asne Zeramene](#Asne-Zeramene)'s four Warders. He is the only one among them who is a Darkfriend, though the others would believe anything she told them and thus might be considered unwitting Darkfriends.

name: Pura
chapter: Chapter 28: News in a Cloth Sack
info: _Damane_, formerly an Aes Sedai of the Yellow Ajah named [Ryma Galfrey](#Ryma-Galfrey). She has been completely broken by her captivity.

name: Queen Ethenielle Kirukan Materasu
chapter: Chapter 27: To Surprise Queens and Kings
info: Holder of the Throne of the Clouds of Kandor—that is, the Queen of Kandor. She is plump, and has gray-streaked black hair. She is about half a hand taller than [Merilille](#Merilille-Ceandevin). She has blue eyes.

name: Queen Ishara Maravaile
info: First Queen of Andor, from whom all other queens are descended. Her husband was Souran Maravaile, one of [Artur Hawkwing](#High-King-Artur-Hawkwing)'s best generals. She governed the Province of Andor until Hawkwing's empire finally fell apart and Andor became an independent nation. All of the Andoran nobles are related to her somehow, although most people would not even consider the ones who hold the closest relation to her to be related at all. None of her sons lived past age twenty, hence the tradition of only having a queen in Andor.

name: Queen Morgase Trakand
info: Former Queen of Andor and High Seat of House Trakand. Mother of [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand) and [Gawyn](#Lord-Gawyn-Trakand). She married [Taringail Damodred](#Taringail-Damodred), a prince of Cairhien, to further solidify her claim to the Throne of Andor and keep peace between the two nations; when Tigraine disappeared, Morgase made the best claim to succeed her, and married her widower to gain the support that would be gained by such action. Taringail was Elayne's and Gawyn's father; he died when they were young. Morgase has since gone through several lovers, including [Thomdril Merrilin](#Thomdril-Thom-Merrilin), a former court-bard; [Gareth Bryne](#Lord-Gareth-Bryne), her First Prince of the Sword and Captain of the Guards; and most recently [Lord Gaebril](#Lord-Gaebril), a man who led the faction that stilled the riots in Caemlyn that sprang up on Morgase's trip to Tar Valon to inquire about Elayne's whereabouts. Thom was exiled from the city of Caemlyn when he started telling her what he really thought of some of her plans, her relationship with Bryne ebbed away until finally Gaebril told her to exile him too, and Gaebril eventually chased Morgase herself out of the city when she found he was usurping her power. The Daughter-Heir of Andor is traditionally trained by Aes Sedai in the White Tower, and Morgase underwent novice training to keep the tradition alive. She was given the gift of a Great Serpent ring despite not being Accepted, and still wears it on her left hand. She was previously advised by [Elaida do Avriny a'Roihan](#Elaida-do-Avriny-a-Roihan) of the Red Ajah, who is now the [Amyrlin Seat](#Amyrlin-Seat) in Tar Valon. When Morgase discovered that Gaebril meant to supplant her, she left, and when she learned that the [Dragon Reborn](#Dragon-Reborn) had taken over Caemlyn and none of her former supporters would give her aid, she fled to Amadicia to get help from the only place she thought she could: [Pedron Niall](#Lord-Captain-Commander-Pedron-Niall) and the Children of the Light. She is not aware that [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) only wanted to give her country back to her, not to mention believes that she is dead. If she made her presence known, she would no doubt have her country back in one piece and all would be well, but as royalty she believes she must work on her own and trust no one. The entire world believes Morgase dead except for a select few. She is currently in hiding, using her mother's name, [Maighdin](#Maighdin-Dorlain) to avoid instant recognition, and a prisoner of the Shaido. Her sign is three golden keys.

name: Queen Nariene
info: Queen of Altara many years ago, immortalized by a statue in Mol Hara square. She was noted for her honesty, but not enought to have been depicted completely bare-chested in her statue.

name: Queen Tenobia si Bashere Kazadi
info: Shield of the North and Sword of the Blightborder, High Seat of House Kazadi, Lady of Shahayni, Asnelle, Kunwar, and Ganai, Queen of Saldaea. She is tall for a woman with an overbold nose like an eagle's beak, a wide mouth, and dark, deep, blue, slanted, almost purple eyes. She is quite pretty. She is niece of her Marshal-General, [Davram Bashere](#Lord-Davram-t-Ghaline-Bashere). She is currently in the Braem Wood with the rest of the rulers of the Borderlands.

name: Raefar Kisman
info: One of [Taim](#Mazrim-Taim)'s close following Asha'man. He was among those who tried to kill [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor).

name: Rafela Cindal
info: Aes Sedai of the Blue Ajah with a round face. She grew up in Tear. She is now sworn to [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor). She negotiated the treaty with the Sea Folk along with [Merana](#Merana-Ambrey). [Min](#Elmindreda-Min-Farshaw) says that [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) should be able to trust her.

name: Rahvin
info: One of the Forsaken. He was fond of using Compulsion, and was known for being a ladies' man—he always had a woman on his arm. After being released from the Bore, he took up residence in Caemlyn as [Lord Gaebril](#Lord-Gaebril), and used Compulsion to have [Queen Morgase](#Queen-Morgase-Trakand) not only make him her advisor, but her lover as well. He eventually planned to take over the country directly as the first ever King of Andor—he did his best to weaken support for Morgase, exiling her supporters and befriending those who opposed her, finally chasing her from the country as well. Shortly after news of Morgase's death or at least abdication reached Cairhien, Rahvin was confronted and killed by [Rand al'Thor](#Rand-al-Thor) in _Tel'aran'rhiod_ with a weave of balefire strong enough to burn Rahvin's soul out of the pattern for hours, perhaps days.

name: Rainyn
info: Apple-cheeked Sea Folk Windfinder. She serves on a soarer.

name: Rana
info: One of [Min](#Elmindreda-Min-Farshaw)'s aunts. She always seemed to know if you did something wrong and made sure you did not want to do it again.

name: Rand al'Thor
info: Young man from Emond's Field in the Two Rivers, now proclaimed to be the [Dragon Reborn](#Dragon-Reborn). He is very tall, with curly red-blond hair. He was raised by Tam al'Thor and his wife Kari (until her death around the time Rand was five) in Emond's Field. His real parents, however, were Janduin, the chief of the Taardad Aiel who brought the four clans across the Dragonwall to punish Laman's Sin, and a Maiden of the Spear named Shaiel, who was actually Tigraine Mantear, the runaway Daughter-Heir of Andor. Tigraine gave birth to Rand on the slopes of Dragonmount, in accordance with prophecy; “born of a Maiden, of the ancient blood but raised by the Old.” Rand has a heron branded into each of his palms, which he received from the sword Tam gave him while fighting [Ishamael](#Ishamael). He also has two dragons on his forearms, which he received in Rhuidean to designate him as the _[Car'a'carn](#Car-a-carn)_, the Chief of Chiefs of the Aiel. He is not only the Dragon Reborn, but also He Who Comes With the Dawn, the man prophesied to reunite the Aiel, and the [Coramoor](#Coramoor), the one prophesied to bring the Sea Folk out of the Sea. He can channel strongly, more so than any person who ever lived (except the previous user of his soul, [Lews Therin Telamon](#Lews-Therin-Telamon), who was obviously of equal strength), and is also _ta'veren_, the most strongly so since Lews Therin as well. Lews Therin's voice has somehow found a new place inside of Rand's head; he talks to him in a mad voice when Rand least expects it, sometimes offering sound advice or knowledge, sometimes babbling, sometimes even trying to wrest control of _saidin_ from him. Unlike Lews Therin, Rand is accompanied by two other _ta'veren_ during this turing of the Wheel, two men born within days (hours, even) of him named [Matrim Cauthon](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon) and [Perrin Aybara](#Perrin-t-Bashere-Aybara), who both grew up in Emond's Field as well. Rand is destined to fall in love with three women (and has): [Min Farshaw](#Elmindreda-Min-Farshaw), [Elayne Trakand](#Elayne-Trakand), and [Aviendha](#Aviendha). Rand has had success in fighting many of the Forsaken; all to confront him have died or been trapped. He killed Aginor at the Eye of the World after the Green Man killed Balthamel; he allowed [Moiraine](#Moiraine-Damodred) to kill Be'lal in the Stone of Tear, and killed [Ishamael](#Ishamael) in the Stone shortly afterward; in the wagons near the Spine of the World, [Lanfear](#Lanfear) confronted him and was pushed into the land of the Eelfinn by Moiraine; he killed [Rahvin](#Rahvin) in _Tel'aran'rhiod_ when he came to the Royal Palace in Caemlyn; and Asmodean, his teacher, was killed shortly after Rahvin met his fate. His prophecies fulfilled grow: he has already been born on the slopes of Dragonmount of a Maiden, of the ancient blood but raised by the old, taken the Stone of Tear and drawn _Callandor_, and began conquering “under the forgotten symbol,” that of the Aes Sedai of the Age of Legends. He is working on having the “spotless tower” (i.e., the White Tower) break and bend knee to him (the Tower has broken, and several Aes Sedai have sworn fealty to him and only him). He has also been bonded by [Alanna Mosvani](#Alanna-Mosvani), an Aes Sedai of the Green Ajah, against his will—the first such bonding in hundreds of years. He plans to use the Choedan Kal, the two great _sa'angreal_ created during the War of the Shadow, to cleanse the [Dark One](#Dark-One)'s taint from _saidin_. He plans to do it soon, to prevent further problems with his Asha'man, men who came for his “amnesty” against male channelers, going mad. He is the salvation of the entire world, and as the prophecy states, he _will_ save the world—and Break it again.

name: Raolin Darksbane
info: False Dragon who declared himself from 335-336 years after the Breaking of the World. His armies beseiged Tar Valon in an attempt to rescue him, an attempt which met with extreme failure. He was born in Aren Mador, now called Far Madding.

name: Rasoria Domanche
info: Stocky Hunter of the Horn from Tear with blue eyes and yellow hair.

name: Reanne Corly
info: Eldest of the Knitting Circle, the ruling group among the women known as the Kin. She has blue eyes, and is quite strong in the One Power; she could match Sheriam, Kwamesa, or [Kiruna](#Kiruna-Nachiman). She claims to be 412 years old. Publicly, she used to arrange shipping for small traders. Since the Kin were brought out of Ebou Dar due to the Seanchan invasion, she has been working on getting the Kin who could not escape out before the Seanchan collar them.

name: Redwing
info: [Medore](#Medore-Damara)'s favorite horse.

name: Reene Harfor
info: [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand)'s chamber greeter and First Maid of the Royal Palace in Andor. She keeps her graying hair in a bun.

name: Renaile din Calon Blue Star
info: Windfinder to the [Mistress of Ships](#Mistress-of-the-Ships) of the Atha'an Miere.

name: Renna Emain
info: _Sul'dam_ who was charged to train and control [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere) when she became a _damane_. She later gave her the nickname “[Tuli](#Tuli).” When Egwene escaped, she put an _a'dam_ around Renna's neck, and left it there when she fled. Renna was later discovered by [Bethamin](#Bethamin-Zeami), wretching from the effort of removing the _a'dam_ in vain. To protect the Seanchan way of life—which would likely collapse if it was learned that _sul'dam_ could learn to channel—Renna retains her rank as _sul'dam_, but is forbidden to be linked with a _damane_. She is kept under close watch by [Suroth](#High-Lady-Suroth-Sabelle-Meldarath).

name: Riselle
chapter: Chapter 15: In Need of a Bellfounder
info: One of [Queen Tylin](#Tylin-Quintara-Mitsobar)'s servants. She has been teaching [Olver](#Olver) how to read—Olver says he likes her, but being that he is only nine, it probably will not work.…

name: Roedran Almaric do Arreloa a'Naloy
info: King of Murandy, at least in name. In reality, Murandians hold allegiance to lords only, and those lords often refuse to pay their taxes to the King. He hopes to make himself the first _true_ king of Murandy in its history. _In the paperback edition, Roedran's name is replaced by [Ailron](#Ailron)'s name at this point in the book, so it would appear that this is a misprint._

name: Rolan
info: Aiel warrior with blue eyes. He captured [Faile](#Faile-ni-Bashere-t-Aybara), cut her clothes off, and carried her to their next camp.

name: Ronaille Vevanios
info: Aes Sedai of unknown Ajah. She was stilled by [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) during the battle at Dumai's Wells. She has since been Healed by [Damer Flinn](#Damer-Flinn).

name: Ronde Macura
info: Dark-haired seamstress from Mardecin. She was one of the eyes-and-ears for the Yellow Ajah. [Nynaeve](#el-Nynaeve-ti-al-Meara-Mandragoran) once spotted the Yellow Ajah's signal outside her shop, and when she and [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand) went inside, Ronde drugged them with forkroot tea. She was going to send them off to Tar Valon as per the orders she was given until [Thom](#Thomdril-Thom-Merrilin) and Juilin rescued the two women. Her failure to bring them back met with severe punishment; [Elaida](#Elaida-do-Avriny-a-Roihan) uses her as a threat to people she has out searching for things. She is now in service of the Seanchan.

name: Rosene
info: One of [Berelain](#Berelain-sur-Paendrag-Paeron)'s servants.

name: Ross Anan
info: Servant in The Wandering Woman, an inn in Ebou Dar. He is [Marah](#Marah-Anan)'s youngest brother and [Setalle](#Setalle-Anan)'s son.

name: Rovair Kirklin
info: [Masuri](#Masuri-Sokawa)'s Warder.

name: Ryma Galfrey
chapter: Chapter 28: News in a Cloth Sack
info: Aes Sedai of the Yellow Ajah, now a _damane_ prisoner of the Seanchan.

name: Ryn Anhara
info: Man who “traps lightning” in big jars—most would say that he has invented the first capacitor.

name: Saerin Asnobar
info: Sitter for the Brown Ajah in Tar Valon from Altara. She carries a curved knife, in the fashion of her native Altara. She has touches of white at her dark temples which emphasize a thin, age-faded white scar. Only a Warder could match her for scowling. She has held her chair in the Hall for forty years, and has worn the shawl for over 150. Everyone knows to be wary of her temper. She was born the daughter of an innkeeper, and was first trained by the Daughters of Silence (an organization similar to, but shorter-lived and smaller than, the Kin)—she was the only one of them to ever obtain the shawl.

name: Santes
info: One of [Berelain](#Berelain-sur-Paendrag-Paeron)'s thief-catchers.

name: Sareitha Tomares
info: Aes Sedai of the Brown Ajah. She has worn the shawl only a short time, only about two years. She grew up in Tear, and has brown hair. She is now sworn to obey [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor), and is presently in Caemlyn.

name: Sarene Nemdahl
info: Aes Sedai of the White Ajah. She has a temper, but she will admit she is wrong if she is. She taught novice classes on “the nature of reality.” Her Warder is Vitalien. She has a secret love of writing poetry—she would die of shame if Vitalien ever discovered that she compares him to a leopard and other graceful, powerful animals in her poems. She assisted in [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor)'s kidnapping, was captured and shielded after the battle at Dumai's Wells, and is now a prisoner of the Aiel, sworn to Rand. According to [Min](#Elmindreda-Min-Farshaw)'s viewing, she will fall in love.

name: Saroth
chapter: Chapter 28: News in a Cloth Sack
info: Misspelling of the name [Suroth](#High-Lady-Suroth-Sabelle-Meldarath). _I believe this was a mere typographical error._

name: Sashalle Anderly
info: Aes Sedai of the Red Ajah. She was stilled by [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) during the battle at Dumai's Wells. She has since been Healed by [Damer Flinn](#Damer-Flinn).

name: Savion Amhara
info: One of the most revered women in the history of Far Madding, birthplace of [Raolin Darksbane](#Raolin-Darksbane) and [Yurian Stonebow](#Yurian-Stonebow). Her statue points toward the Tear gate.

name: Seaine Herimon
info: Sitter for the White Ajah in Tar Valon. When the Hall was arguing over who to raise as [Amyrlin](#Amyrlin-Seat) years back, it was deadlocked over four candidates who had each worn the shawl about fifty years; the Hall wanted an Amyrlin that was younger than the eighty or more years than were common. Seaine suggested [Siuan Sanche](#Siuan-Sanche), then a young Blue sister that had worn the shawl for ten years; she was eventually raised. Later, Seaine was charged by [Elaida](#Elaida-do-Avriny-a-Roihan) to find Darkfriends in the Tower; Elaida hopes to expose [Alviarin](#Alviarin-Freidhen) on the suspicion that she is Black Ajah. She and her friend since novicehood, [Pevara](#Pevara-Tazanovni), have successfully captured and bound with the Oath Rod a few members of the Black Ajah.

name: Sebban Balwer
info: Formerly [Pedron Niall](#Lord-Captain-Commander-Pedron-Niall)'s “dry little stick of a secretary.” He was in reality the Master of Spies for the Children of the Light; his identity was known only to Niall. His skills have proven useful to his new traveling group, [Perrin](#Perrin-t-Bashere-Aybara) and company.

name: Selande Darengil
info: One of [Faile](#Faile-ni-Bashere-t-Aybara)'s new servants, one of the Cairhienin women who tries to imitate the Aiel Maidens of the Spear, only using swords instead. She is the leader of the _Cha Faile_ (Falcon's Talon) sept of the Aiel imitators.

name: Selucia
info: One of [Tuon](#Tuon-Athaem-Kore-Paendrag)'s servants; the one who shaves her head every morning. She has golden hair.

name: Semirhage
info: One of the Forsaken. During the Age of Legends, she was one of the best Healers ever known. She was called to all corners of the world Heal people that others thought beyond help. However, she was sadistic; she exacted a price in the form of pain from her subjects in return for her Healing services. Most thought the pain or anguish she exacted from them was a small price to pay for being alive, but eventually the Hall of Servants found out about her practices and gave her the choice of being either severed or bound with the Power, never again to know her “pleasures.” She chose instead to pledge for the [Dark One](#Dark-One), and created one of the most oppressive and pain-filled areas of Shadow control during the entire War of Power. After being freed from the Bore, Semirhage went in service to the Dark One by extracting information from captured Borderlanders and Aes Sedai. She also sent the Trollocs to the Stone of Tear to battle those that Sammael sent. She is as tall as most men, and wears black most of the time—perhaps because [Lanfear](#Lanfear) always wore white. It is often joked (or used to be, when the Forsaken were still bound) that when it rained during the daylight that the Dark One was beating her.

name: Senine din Ryal
info: Sea Folk Windfinder of a soarer, one of the smallest of vessels in use by the Atha'an Miere. She was a Windfinder to the Mistress of the Ships before [Nesta](#Nesta-din-Reas-Two-Moons) succeeded her. She was then forced to start over from the bottom.

name: Seonid Traighan
info: Aes Sedai of the Green Ajah. She grew up in Cairhien. She was part of Salidar's embassy to [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor). She now travels with [Perrin](#Perrin-t-Bashere-Aybara) and company. She has two Warders.

name: Sera
info: _Damane_ in personal service to [Tuon](#Tuon-Athaem-Kore-Paendrag). She has tightly curled black hair.

name: Sereille Bagand
info: Late Aes Sedai of the White Ajah. She was [Mistress of Novices](#Mistress-of-Novices) when [Adeleas](#Adeleas-Namelle) and [Vandene](#Vandene-Namelle) were novices, and was later raised to the [Amyrlin Seat](#Amyrlin-Seat). She was a legend for her harshness.

name: Seta Zarbey
info: Name of the _sul'dam_ that [Nynaeve](#el-Nynaeve-ti-al-Meara-Mandragoran) collared before rescuing [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere) at Falme. [Bethamin](#Bethamin-Zeami) discovered her, wretching from the effort of removing the _a'dam_ in vain. To protect the Seanchan way of life—which would likely collapse if it was learned that _sul'dam_ could learn to channel—Seta retains her rank as _sul'dam_, but is forbidden to be linked with a _damane_. She is kept under close watch by [Suroth](#High-Lady-Suroth-Sabelle-Meldarath).

name: Setalle Anan
info: Stately innkeeper of The Wandering Woman, the inn at which [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon) and [Olver](#Olver) stayed at in Ebou Dar. She has hazel eyes, marking her a non-native to Ebou Dar. She works closely with the Kin, and knew of their existance despite not being a part of it.

name: Sevanna
info: Wise One of the Jumai sept of the Shaido Aiel. She is the widow of the last two chiefs of the Shaido, Suladric and [Couladin](#Couladin). She has green eyes. She knows that the easiest way to power for herself is to attach herself to men who already hold power; she even envisioned marrying [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) (against his will) to gain power through him. She is currently leading her clan (and any Aiel deserters that joined her) through Ghealdan, where they were sent from Kinslayer's Dagger by Sammael. She constantly wants more _gai'shain_—her goal is to indenture the entire world.

name: Shalon din Togara Morning Tide
info: Windfinder of Clan Shodein. She was left under a bed, bound with the Power and shielded, by [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor), in the middle of the attack by the Asha'man. She has not been seen since.

name: Sharina Melloy
info: Grandmother recruited as a novice along the way from Salidar to Tar Valon. She has more potential than [Nynaeve](#el-Nynaeve-ti-al-Meara-Mandragoran). _There is a distinct possibility that this Sharina is the same one as the Aes Sedai advisor to Nynaeve and [Lan](#al-Lan-Mandragoran) from Nynaeve's test for being raised to Accepted._

name: Sheraine Caminelle
info: Real name of [Mylen](#Mylen). She does not answer to it anymore.

name: Shielyn din Sabura Night Waters
info: Windfinder to [Zaida](#Zaida-din-Parede-Black-Wing), Wavemistress of Clan Catelar. She is slender and cooly reserved. She is almost as tall as [Aviendha](#Aviendha).

name: Shyanda
info: Fiery red-haired Wise One. She helps “suffer the pangs of birth” for [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand) and [Aviendha](#Aviendha).

name: Sierin Vayu
info: [Amrylin Seat](#Amyrlin-Seat) years ago, two Amyrlins before [Siuan Sanche](#Siuan-Sanche). She was raised from the Gray Ajah, but according to [Moiraine](#Moiraine-Damodred) she had more than a touch of Red in her. She only reigned for about two years, then died abruptly; [Alviarin](#Alviarin-Freidhen) wonders whether [Elaida](#Elaida-do-Avriny-a-Roihan) had a hand in her death; the Black Ajah did not. In fact, [Chesmal Emry](#Chesmal-Emry) convinced the Red Ajah to kill her before she could arrest her.

name: Siuan Sanche
info: Aes Sedai of the Blue Ajah. Born in Tear to a fisherman, she was sent to the White Tower on the first boat to leave after she discovered she had the ability to channel inborn, according to Tairen law. As a novice, she was good friends with [Moiraine Damodred](#Moiraine-Damodred), and was present at Gitara Moroso's Foretelling of the Rebirth of the [Dragon](#The-Dragon). After being raised to the shawl, she joined the Blue Ajah to dedicate her life to finding and guiding the [Dragon Reborn](#Dragon-Reborn), and eventually came to lead the Blues' network of eyes-and-ears (i.e., spies) before being raised to the [Amyrlin Seat](#Amyrlin-Seat). She was only thirty years old when raised to the Amyrlin Seat, making her the youngest Amyrlin to date. She was also one of the strongest Amyrlins in recent history, and one of the most feared among the rulers of nations. Her blue-eyed stare was feared by all. When her twenty-year connection to the [Dragon Reborn](#Dragon-Reborn) was discovered, she and her Keeper of the Chronicles, Leane Sharif, were deposed and stilled by a group of sisters loyal to [Elaida a'Roihan](#Elaida-do-Avriny-a-Roihan). Siuan hoped to regain some of her previous standing in the new Tower that separated from Elaida—her knowledge of the Blue Ajah spy network is hard to match, and she knows much that she thinks would be of use. In one of her viewings, [Min](#Elmindreda-Min-Farshaw) saw that Siuan would have to remain close by to [Gareth Bryne](#Lord-Gareth-Bryne)—if she did not, both of them would die. Siuan did not initially know what she meant, but now realizes that she is growing to love the gray-haired man who leads the Salidar army. She had a Warder named Alric, but he died when she was deposed. After coming to Salidar, [Nynaeve](#el-Nynaeve-ti-al-Meara-Mandragoran) discovered how to restore Siuan's ability to channel, at least partially. This resurrected a part of her bond with Alric, but did not bring back her former strength, or her binding by the Oath Rod. She can now lie as well as any child. She now serves as an “advisor” to the new Amyrlin in Salidar, [Egwene al'Vere](#Egwene-al-Vere), but though she puts on a façade of hating the work, she is actually one of Egwene's foremost agents. The fact that she is Aes Sedai, not to mention one who was stilled and Healed again, makes other sisters tend to be oblivious to this fact.

name: Solain Morgeillin
info: One of the Kin. She has charge of a woman on an _a'dam_ in the Palace in Caemlyn, along with [Keraille](#Keraille-Surtovni).

name: Someryn
info: Wise One of the Shaido Aiel. She is as tall as most non-Aiel men, and is fond of revealing dresses and jewelry. She is stronger in the One Power than any woman in the White Tower.

name: Sorilea
info: Wise One of Shende Hold, of the Jarra sept of the Chareen Aiel. She has thin, white hair; tight, leathery skin; and green eyes. She can channel, but weakly. She is about a head taller than [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere). She is the strongest-willed of the Wise Ones—even other Wise Ones scurry to do her bidding, and _no one_ gives her orders.

name: Soulblinder
info: Seanchan name for the [Dark One](#Dark-One).

name: Springhorn
info: Leader of a wolfpack.

name: Stayer
info: One of [Perrin](#Perrin-t-Bashere-Aybara)'s horses. He is a stallion.

name: Stepper
info: One of [Perrin](#Perrin-t-Bashere-Aybara)'s horses.

name: Suana Dragand
info: Aes Sedai of the Yellow Ajah in Tar Valon. She is probably the head of the Yellow Ajah, by [Seaine](#Seaine-Herimon)'s observation.

name: Sulin
info: Goshien Maiden of the Spear with white hair. She led [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor)'s honor guard until she accidentally spoke to _gai'shain_ as if they were still Maidens of the Spear. To attempt to equal their shame, she became a servant in the palace, dressed in the same clothing they wore and attempted to behave in their manner. She ended her tenure as a servant when she learned that Rand had been captured, and led the rescue party of Maidens to Dumai's Wells. She then went with [Perrin](#Perrin-t-Bashere-Aybara) to find [Masema](#Masema-Dagar), and led the team of Maidens to search for [Faile](#Faile-ni-Bashere-t-Aybara) when she was captured.

name: Sumeko Karistovan
info: One of the Kin. She is a very skilled Healer, and has developed methods of Healing that not even [Nynaeve](#el-Nynaeve-ti-al-Meara-Mandragoran) has been able to develop—in fact, the only thing similar would be the methods [Damer Flinn](#Damer-Flinn) has developed among the Asha'man. She is possibly the most skilled female Healer alive outside of [Semirhage](#Semirhage). She is stout. Unfortunately, Sumeko's abilities in Healing have caused her to occasionally rise above herself—one of her gravest errors was to call Nynaeve “girl.”

name: Surlivan Sarat
info: One of [Queen Tylin](#Tylin-Quintara-Mitsobar)'s officers. He is a good fellow, has a good sense of humor, and an eye for horses.

name: Sybaine
info: Member of the First Council of Far Madding. She has gray hair.

name: Talaan din Gelyn
info: Boyishly slim Sea Folk Windfinder apprentice. She is almost as strong in the One Power as [Nynaeve](#el-Nynaeve-ti-al-Meara-Mandragoran). She is [Caire](#Caire-din-Gelyn-Running-Wave)'s daughter. She is only nineteen. She feels a lot of pressure to be prominent among the Windfinders—her grandmother is Windfinder to the Wavemistress of Clan Rossaine, her great-grandmother is Windfinder to Clan Dacan, and her great-great-aunt is Windfinder to Clan Takana, all in addition to her mother and aunt.

name: Talene Minly
info: Golden-haired Sitter for the Green Ajah in Tar Valon. She used to be [Seaine](#Seaine-Herimon)'s friend. She has no Warders, which is extremely unusual for a Green. When [Pevara](#Pevara-Tazanovni) shielded her because she suspected her of being Black Ajah, she tried to stab her. She is now sworn to obey Pevara and Seaine unconditionally.

name: Talmanes Delovinde
chapter: Chapter 15: In Need of a Bellfounder
info: Cairhienin military commander, about three years older than [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon) and about a head shorter. His _con_ is three yellow stars on a blue field. His banner is a black fox. He rarely smiles, and reminds Mat of a compressed spring. He commands about half of Mat's cavalry in the Band of the Red Hand, and acts as the leader of the entire Band in Mat's absence.

name: Tamela
info: Bony, angular-faced Wise One. She is stronger in the One Power than [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand). She sneers at Elayne a lot.

name: Tamra Ospenya
info: [Amyrlin Seat](#Amyrlin-Seat) during the Aiel War, about twenty years ago. She was raised from the Blue Ajah, and succeeded by [Sierin Vayu](#Sierin-Vayu). She was put to the Question by Jarna Malari, then the head of the Black Ajah, with assistance from [Chesmal Emry](#Chesmal-Emry), who made it appear that she died in her sleep.
