Her Keeper of the Chronicles was Gitara Moroso; she was one of only three people present at Gitara's Foretelling of the Rebirth of the [Dragon](#The-Dragon). This may be the information that Jarna was trying to extract from her; it may also be the reason [Ishamael](#Ishamael) killed Jarna for killing Tamra.

name: Taringail Damodred
info: A Prince of Cairhien and First Prince of the Sword of Andor until his death. His first wife, Tigraine, the then Daughter-Heir of Andor, bore him a son, Galad, before she vanished, causing the War of Succession. After the war was over, he married [Morgase Trakand](#Queen-Morgase-Trakand), the new Queen. Taringail and Morgase had two children, [Gawyn](#Lord-Gawyn-Trakand) and [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand). He died when Elayne was barely old enough to remember him, which was probably fortunate for Morgase; unbeknownst to her, he had planned to engineer her death and make himself the first King of Andor in a millenium.

name: Tebreille din Gelyn South Wind
info: Windfinder to a Clan Wavemistress. She is [Caire](#Caire-din-Gelyn-Running-Wave)'s sister and [Talaan](#Talaan-din-Gelyn)'s aunt. She and her sister do not get along well—they compete too much.

name: Temaile Kinderode
info: Aes Sedai of the Black Ajah, formerly of the Gray. A fragile woman from Cairhien with very big, blue eyes and a face like a fox. She always spread pain evenly in her mediating.

name: Teryl Wynter
info: One of [Seonid](#Seonid-Traighan)'s Warders. He has dark reddish hair, a curled mustache, and _very_ blue eyes.

name: Teslyn Baradon
info: Aes Sedai of the Red Ajah from Illian. She has a sharp face, narrow shoulders, gaunt cheeks, and a narrow nose. She was a Sitter for the Red for fifteen years until [Elaida](#Elaida-do-Avriny-a-Roihan) was raised and asked her to step down from the Hall. Elaida sent her to Ebou Dar to meet with [Queen Tylin](#Tylin-Quintara-Mitsobar) of Altara. When the Seanchan invaded, she was captured and made _damane_.

name: Tessi
info: _Damane_ under the discipline of [Bethamin](#Bethamin-Zeami). She has been rewarded recently, with treats.

name: The Creator
info: Maker of the Universe, people, places, things, the True Source, everything in existence. An alternate name would be God. After He created the world, the Creator made a prison for [Shai'tan](#Dark-One), the Dark One, His complete opposite in every way, to keep him from influencing the world. The Creator is bent on non-interference—He will not directly influence events in the world, instead using a “Chosen One” or simply tugging at the Pattern of the Age in hopes that what He wants to occur will occur, instead of just making it happen. The Forsaken and most Darkfriends consider Him to be inferior to the Dark One, despite the fact that He imprisoned him.

name: The Dragon
info: Name by which [Lews Therin Telamon](#Lews-Therin-Telamon) was known by during the War of the Shadow. His Rebirth, the [Dragon Reborn](#Dragon-Reborn), is alive and fulfilling all of the Prophecies set to signal his return.

name: The Empress (of Seanchan)
info: Supreme ruler of Seanchan. She is considered to be a direct descendant of the first emperor of Seanchan, [Luthair Paendrag Mondwhin](#Emperor-Luthair-Paendrag-Mondwhin). She presides over the Court of the Nine Moons on the Seanchan continent. She is [Tuon](#Tuon-Athaem-Kore-Paendrag)'s mother.

name: The Prophet of the Dragon
info: Title given [Masema](#Masema-Dagar) as the self-appointed bringer of the news of the Rebirth of the [Dragon](#The-Dragon). He is not necessarily sane anymore, but has gained a very large following. [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) is getting to the point where he needs to do something about him, and sent [Perrin](#Perrin-t-Bashere-Aybara) to Ghealdan with a few of the Asha'man and some of the sworn Aes Sedai to bring him in line.

name: Theodrin Dabei
info: Slim, apple-cheeked Aes Sedai of the Brown Ajah. She was among the four raised to full sisterhood by [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere). Before being raised, she tried to dismantle [Nynaeve](#el-Nynaeve-ti-al-Meara-Mandragoran)'s block without success. The rest of the sisters still treat her like an Accepted.

name: Thera
chapter: Chapter 28: News in a Cloth Sack
info: One of [Suroth](#High-Lady-Suroth-Sabelle-Meldarath)'s _da'covale_. She and [Juilin](#Juilin-Sandar) have a budding relationship. She is actually the Panarch of Tarabon, Amathera.

name: Therava
info: Therava, p. 126 (133–134)—Wise One of the Shaido Aiel. She is stronger in the One Power than any Aes Sedai in the White Tower. She was the one who captured [Galina Casban](#Galina-Casban) after the battle at Dumai's Wells. She has very good eyes.

name: Thomdril (Thom) Merrilin
info: Gleeman who came to Emond's Field on Winternight just before the Trollocs came. He is quite the ladies' man. Thom is good at juggling, sleight-of-hand, and all kinds of other tricks. He also carries several concealed knives up his sleeves, in his boots, and in various other locations on his body; this practice seems to have spread from Thom to [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon), [Min](#Elmindreda-Min-Farshaw), and [Faile](#Faile-ni-Bashere-t-Aybara). Thom was originally a bard in [Queen Morgase](#Queen-Morgase-Trakand)'s Royal Court, and for a time after her husband [Taringail Damodred](#Taringail-Damodred) died, he was the Queen's lover. During his run from a Fade at Shadar Logoth, he was injured, and now walks with a limp because of it. Thom is getting old, such that he is starting to realize that he cannot do the backflips and other stunts he used to do. He accompanied [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand) and [Nynaeve](#el-Nynaeve-ti-al-Meara-Mandragoran) on their travels as per [Moiraine](#Moiraine-Damodred)'s request, despite the fact that he has never felt comfortable around Aes Sedai since his nephew, Owyn, was gentled by the Red Ajah. Thom is an expert in the Game of Houses; in fact, his girlfried Dena was killed by Cairhienin soldiers because they thought he was trying to play _Daes Daemar_ against the Royal House.

name: Three Toes
info: Leader of a wolfpack.

name: Tiam of Gazar
info: Person who proposed the Gazaran Calendar, which celebrated the alleged freedom from the Trolloc threat by recording Free Years (FY). This calendar was adopted due to the chaos the resulted during the Trolloc Wars and the resulting confusion as to which year it actually was under the Toman Calendar.

name: Timna
info: Resident of Tremalking who sees the female Choedan Kal glow from use. She knew that this signalled the beginning of a new era; one of Tremalking's prophecies stated that when the hand and globe glowed, it would signal a great change.

name: Toma dur Ahmid
info: Person who devised the Toman Calendar, which was adopted approximately two hundred years after the death of the last male Aes Sedai and continued until the Trolloc Wars. The Calendar recorded years After the Breaking, or AB.

name: Tomas
info: Warder bonded to [Verin](#Verin-Mathwin). He is old and haggard, but still quite spry.

name: Tormon
info: Solid, reliable man from Illian who informed [Dyelin](#Dyelin-Taravin) of the armies in the Braem Wood poised to march on Andor.

name: Toveine Gazal
info: Aes Sedai of the Red Ajah. She spent fifteen years away from the Tower until [Elaida](#Elaida-do-Avriny-a-Roihan) summoned her back to active service. She was formerly a Sitter for the Red. Elaida named her to lead the team of fifty sisters that she sent to Caemlyn to attempt to capture any men who can channel that they found. Unfortunately, she and Elaida drastically underestimated the number of men there would be, and Toveine is now [Logain](#Lord-Logain-Ablar)'s “wife,” their equivalent to Warders (actually, Logain has _two_ such wives now).

name: Tuli
info: [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere)'s name as a _damane_. [Bethamin](#Bethamin-Zeami) went to check on her, the “girl with the remarkable affinity for metals and ores,” before the battle at Falme. When Bethamin arrived, she found the two _sul'dam_ that Egwene and her rescuers captured.

name: Tuon Athaem Kore Paendrag
info: Second daughter of the [Empress](#The-Empress-of-Seanchan-), heir to the Crystal Throne of Seanchan, and leader of the _Corenne_, the Return. She has brown eyes and no hair (it has been shaved off). She is also called the [Daughter of the Nine Moons](#Daughter-of-the-Nine-Moons), the woman [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon) was told he will marry.

name: Twilight
info: Leader of a wolfpack.

name: Tylin Quintara Mitsobar
chapter: Chapter 15: In Need of a Bellfounder
info: By the Grace of the Light, Queen of Altara, Mistress of the Four Winds, Guardian of the Sea of Storms, High Seat of House Mitsobar. Her kingdom was small, and she only ruled a portion of it; the rest was governed by nobles who are not necessarily loyal to her. She was the second from her House to sit on the throne—this is the maximum traditionally, and the only House to hold it for four generations fell so fast from power that it could not recover. She was advised by [Merilille Ceandevin](#Merilille-Ceandevin) of the Gray Ajah. She is a widow, and does not plan to marry again. However, she took an interest in [Mat Cauthon](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon), and contrary to Mat's usual tactic of chasing women, _she_ chased and caught _him_. The two have been lovers for some time now, although Mat is not certain he could get out of the relationship should he see dire need to. When the Seanchan invaded her nation, she cooperated with them out of necessity—they let her keep her position of authority, but is now a puppet of the Crystal Throne.

name: Tzigan Sokorin
info: Ghealdanin member of the Queen's Guards of Andor. She claims to be the daughter of a minor noble.

name: Uren din Jubai Soaring Gull
info: Sea Folk scholar and deviser of the [Farede](#Panarch-Farede) Calendar, which measured dates from the arbitrarily set end of the War of the Hundred Years as years of the New Era (NE). This calendar is currently in use.

name: Valan Luca
chapter: Chapter 15: In Need of a Bellfounder
info: Owner of the menagerie that [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand) and [Nynaeve](#el-Nynaeve-ti-al-Meara-Mandragoran) encounterd in Amadicia. He is still in business, although he now has to deal with Seanchan troops in the country.

name: Vandene Namelle
info: Aes Sedai of the Green Ajah, one of two Aes Sedai who went into voluntary retreat many years ago to Tifan's Well, a village located in the grassy plains of Arafel, along with her sister [Adeleas](#Adeleas-Namelle). Their goal was some day to write the complete history of the World since the Breaking, and some even before that. Vandene and Adeleas came to Salidar to escape [Elaida](#Elaida-do-Avriny-a-Roihan)'s summons back to the Tower. They now travel with the Aes Sedai, Accepted, novices, and troops on their way to Tar Valon.

name: Vayelle Kamsa
info: Aes Sedai captured at Dumai's Wells. She asked to swear fealty to [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor).

name: Venr Kosaan
info: One of [Careane](#Careane-Fransi)'s Warders. He has dark skin, gray in his curly hear, and a beard. He is blade-thin.

name: Verin Mathwin
info: Aes Sedai of the Brown Ajah who accompanied [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere), [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand), and [Nynaeve](#el-Nynaeve-ti-al-Meara-Mandragoran) back from Falme to Tar Valon. Her Warder is named [Tomas](#Tomas). She is more interested in current events than the average Brown; most of them could not care less what happened now, only what happened years ago. She gave Egwene the twisted stone ring _ter'angreal_ to assist her in Dreaming, and also once told [Morgase](#Queen-Morgase-Trakand) that there was really no need to keep her in the Tower until she learned to control her ability when she was a novice, since she would never be able to do much with it anyway. When Verin went to the Two Rivers with [Alanna](#Alanna-Mosvani), they helped to fight the Trollocs that attacked, and when they left they brought a half-dozen young women with them who could channel, including [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon)'s sister [Bode](#Bodewhin-Bode-Cauthon). When she and Alanna reached Caemlyn, they found that the Tower had been broken, and decided to side with the Salidar embassy when it reached town. Verin is quite old—her hair is starting to turn gray, which to an Aes Sedai means she is quite old indeed.

name: Viendre
info: Beautiful, blue-eyed Wise One. She is stronger in the One Power than [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand). She sneers at Elayne a lot.

name: Welyn Kajima
info: Dedicated in his middle years. [Toveine](#Toveine-Gazal) thinks he smiles too much. He is the “husband” of [Jenare](#Jenare). Before coming to the Black Tower, he was a clerk in Arafel.

name: Wind
info: [Olver](#Olver)'s horse. He deserves the name; he is quite quick, and wins most of the races he runs.

name: Young Bull
info: Name the wolves use for [Perrin](#Perrin-t-Bashere-Aybara). It is actually an image, one of the simpler ones in fact, much more complex than simply “Young Bull.”

name: Yukiri
info: Aes Sedai of the Gray Ajah. She is quite small, and is a Sitter for the Gray.

name: Yurian Stonebow
info: False [Dragon](#The-Dragon) of an era before the Trolloc Wars. Six Aes Sedai attempted to capture him; he killed three of them and captured the rest himself. He was born in Fel Moreina, which is now called Far Madding.

name: Yuril
info: Sharp-nosed man who people think is [Tuon](#Tuon-Athaem-Kore-Paendrag)'s secretary. He is, but he also commands her Seekers of the Truth.

name: Zaida din Parede Black Wing
info: Sea Folk wavemistress. She is very commanding, and expects obedience from everyone. She is quite beautiful. Zaida is the Wavemistress of Clan Catelar and the ambassador to [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) from [Nesta din Reas](#Nesta-din-Reas-Two-Moons), [Mistress of the Ships](#Mistress-of-the-Ships) to the Sea Folk.

name: Zarya Alkaese
info: Real name of [Garenia](#Garenia-Rosoinde), the name she used as a novice before [Vandene](#Vandene-Namelle) and [Adeleas](#Adeleas-Namelle) left on their retreat to Tifan's Well. She has a strong nose and a wide mouth. She is actually over ninety, but she looks like she is not yet into middle age.

name: Zerah Dacan
info: Aes Sedai of the White Ajah. She was one of the sisters sent back to Tar Valon by the Aes Sedai gathered in Salidar to spread news of [Logain](#Lord-Logain-Ablar)'s being set up by Reds as a false [Dragon](#The-Dragon) and attempt to build resistance to [Elaida](#Elaida-do-Avriny-a-Roihan) within the Tower.

name: Zeram
info: Bootmaker from Far Madding. [Torval](#Peral-Torval) and [Gedwyn](#Charl-Gedwyn) are staying above him.

name: Zushi
info: Sea Folk Windfinder now collared by the Seanchan. [Bethamin](#Bethamin-Zeami) has her marked for a switching—she refuses to eat, and is losing a lot of weight.

name: al'Lan Mandragoran
info: The uncrowned king of Malkier, and formerly Warder to [Moiraine](#Moiraine-Damodred). He is quite tall, and does not get very emotional—in fact, he has emotional walls all around him that he has been building for years. His country, Malkier, was overrun by Trollocs shortly after he was born, and is now corrupted by the Great Blight. Lan, the last of his people, then proceeded to fight a one-man war against the Shadow by killing Shadowspawn in the Blight. He fought Aiel during the Aiel War, and achieved Blademaster status. He was eventually bonded by Moiraine, which ended his lonely fight (or at least changed its style). When Lan and Moiraine brought [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor), [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon), [Perrin](#Perrin-t-Bashere-Aybara), [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere), and [Nynaeve](#el-Nynaeve-ti-al-Meara-Mandragoran) out of their home in the Two Rivers, he found that there was something which could throw his guard down, but he was the last to notice it: affection for Nynaeve. As Moiraine put it, Nynaeve was able to plant vines in Lan's emotional walls and break them down without him even knowing they were there. The two of them are now married. Upon Moiraine's death, Lan's bond was immediately transferred to [Myrelle](#Myrelle-Berengari) until Nynaeve is ready to have his bond transferred to her. Myrelle tried to keep Lan's status secret, but she was given away when she tried to buy one of Lan's favorite foods, coin peppers, too far south (they are very popular in Shienar, and were in Malkier before it fell to the Blight, but do not grow well in southern climates). Upon learning of where Lan was, [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere) sent him to Ebou Dar to serve as a Warder for Nynaeve. He now travels with his wife and the group of Aes Sedai she leads. According to the Wise Ones, _[Aan'allein](#Aan-allein)_ (as the Aiel call him) will die the day he learns that Nynaeve is dead. He is one of the best, if not _the_ best, warriors in the World.

name: el'Nynaeve ti al'Meara Mandragoran
info: Young woman from Emond's Field, now an Aes Sedai of the Yellow Ajah. She was the Wisdom of her village, the youngest such ever chosen in Emond's Field. She left when four of her villagers were taken away from the Two Rivers by [Moiraine](#Moiraine-Damodred) and [Lan](#al-Lan-Mandragoran). While the group traveled away from her home and toward her new life, Nynaeve made several discoveries: she could channel the One Power, and had already done so without really knowing what she was doing; she developed feelings for Lan Mandragoran, Moiraine's Warder and the uncrowned king of the now dead nation Malkier; and she has a major role to play, as all of her younger friends in the group do, in the years to come. She is very strong in the One Power; only a select few who were alive during the Age of Legends could match her as well as a few young women still being trained. When she arrived in Tar Valon, she was raised Accepted without any tenure as a novice, despite not being able to even _sense_ the True Source unless angry, a result of her having to learn some minimal control of her ability without teaching. She was sent on a false mission by [Liandrin](#Liandrin) on which she was almost leashed by the Seanchan as [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere) was. After she returned to the Tower, [Siuan Sanche](#Siuan-Sanche) sent her on a mission to hunt down Liandrin and her fellow Black Sisters; while hunting them in Tanchico, she encountered [Moghedien](#Moghedien) and managed to better her in a duel of the Power. Moghedien escaped, but two encounters later Nynaeve once again managed to get the better of her, leashing her with an _a'dam_ in _Tel'aran'rhiod_. Nynaeve took Moghedien with her to seek out [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) and [Rahvin](#Rahvin) while they were fighting each other, and at the last moment before Rahvin might have won, she nearly burned Rahvin to ash with a giant weave of fire that was most of what Moghedien could draw to produce it; the distraction was enough for Rand to regain control of himself and destroy Rahvin with balefire. Nynaeve then kept Moghedien under control with a modified _a'dam_ in Salidar. Nynaeve wished to become Aes Sedai for the sole purpose of Healing; she thinks the Tower meddles in the affairs of nations far too much, and wants no part of it. She is determined to Heal anything short of death, and has already managed to Heal gentling. Nynaeve felt bad when Moiraine died, because her first thought was not of her, but that now Lan was free from their bond. She was not told that Lan's bond had been passed to [Myrelle](#Myrelle-Berengari) the moment of Moiraine's death. She and Lan are now married, and the plan is for Lan's bond to pass to her as soon as she and Myrelle can get together. She now wears the _ki'sain_, an ornament traditionally worn by Malkieri wives, consisting of a dot on the forehead between the eyes—Lan did not tell her of this tradition, but when she found out she immediately took it up. It is the one element of her appearance that never fades for one second when every other part changes faster than the eye can follow in _tel'aran'rhiod_.
